Node.RefEnglish: {I will dwell Ｉ will walk among (them) God people will receive a father sons}
Node.RefLemma: {ἐνοικέω ἐμπεριπατέω θεός λαός εἰσδέχομαι πατήρ υἱός}

Node.Notes: This participle has been explained in at least 4 different ways (see NIGTC commentary by M. Harris). The tree here sees three clauses conjoined (what are true) that are in contrast to what is not, namely "our flesh had rest."
Assumes: [He encouraged us] not only by his coming but also by the encouragement with which he was encouraged by you, reporting ...

Node.FrameGloss: {A0:this A2:in you A1:diligence;(what) defense;(what) indignation;(what) fear;(what) longing;(what) zeal;(what) vengeance}
